text:
Our remote support businesses
are telephony, video,

and messaging, and our
vision within there was

to deliver seamless digital
experiences whilst personalizing
the human moments

to help the customers
when it really matters.
So what we're trying to do is take
away customer pain points.

One of the founding
principles of why we went
to Amazon Connect was

because of seamless interaction
across our channels.
What we're describing there is the way
that you can start in the mobile journey,
be authenticated once,

and be seamlessly passed
through to telephony.

The level of data that we're
now getting can really help
with them with operational challenges.
When you wanted to go through

and develop multiple different
things like self-serve

journeys for our customers,
that could take a number
of months to do that.

What we've seen with
going to Amazon Connect,
that's down to days.

We understand so much
more about our customers

and the reasons that they're
coming into telephony in the

first place that allows us to
improve our customer journeys.
But we're also able to utilize more

and more of the insights that
we get out of Amazon Connect

to help resolve the
first point of contact.
And for NatWest Group, what

that means is we can
always be at the forefront

of technology and being able
to bring this to our customers

to help to make their
lives so much easier.
